com.company

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the game board of a three-dimensional connect 4 game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(java.lang.String filename)
        Loads the board from a file. The file must have 24 lines with 7 characters each. The characters can only be spaces, X or O.
        Parameters:
        filename - path to the file

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public int evaluate(char player)
        Evaluates the favorability of the board as seen by the specified player. Therefore all possible lines with a length of 4 are evaluated and added to the final score (there are 456 positions on a 4x7x6 field).
        Possible lines that are not occupied by the enemy with at least one token receive a score according to the number of tokens the player has placed on this line. The score is calculated as 5^(number of tokens). This means that empty lines receive a score of 1, lines with one token of the player 5 and so on.

        The pseudo-code for the algorithm can be found below. Because this methods visits all possible lines twice (once with A as startfield and B as endfield, once the other way around), the final score must be divided by 2.
        This represents a small performance impact. We decided to use this algorithm anyway because:
        1. The alternative would be to maintain a list of positions visited and check each time, if the current position is already on this list. The would probably be a much larger overhead and requires to maintain a data structure in memory.
        2. This adds only a constant factor of 2 to the complexity of the algorithm. Because of the exponential complexity of the Minimax-algorithm this can be neglected.
         score = 0
 iterate over all fields : startfield {
     for each of the 26 possible directions : direction {
         if line of 4 is possible from startfield in direction {
              ecount = number of tokens from enemy in line
              scound = number of tokes from self in line

              if ecount == 4 return -inf
              if scount == 4 return +inf
              if ecount == 0 score += 5^scount
         }
     }
 }
 return score/2
        Parameters:
        player - Player from whose view the board will be evaluated.
        Returns:
        favorability of the board

      • placeToken

        public boolean placeToken(char player,
                          int x,
                          int y)
        Places a token for the specified player at the specified x and y position on top of the stack.
        Parameters:
        player - which token to place on the board
        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate
        Returns:
        true or false, whether the move was successful (i.e. the stack was not full)
